newsitem.title: NORWAY: Statoil plans first Irish spud for March.
newsitem.headline: Statoil plans first Irish spud for March.

text.p: Den norske stats oljeselskap AS (Statoil) will begin drilling on the Connemara field on the Irish continental shelf in March, 1997, the company's Status Weekly newsletter said on Thursday.

Spudding of the first well will begin on March 1, with 60 days of test production scheduled to run parallel to the drilling of a second well. The second well is scheduled for 15 days of test production.
Results from the tests will determine whether Connemara becomes the first development off the Irish west coast, Statoil said.
The field, located in 365 metres of water, was considered non-commercial when discovered by British Petroleum Co Plc in 1979.
"However, new mapping has raised hopes that it can be developed with a production ship," Statoil said.
The rig J W McLean, owned by Reading & Bates, was contracted to drill the wells.
